ygData.subject: RE: Selo's
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Maravana, It was good to meet you in game this week.  Thanks for your help. In answer to your question, at level 23, perceptually, I was moving faster last
ygData.messageBody:
Hi Maravana,

It was good to meet you in game this week. Thanks for your help.

In answer to your question, at level 23, perceptually, I was moving faster
last night than before the patch.

Tomerrilin

-----Original Message-----
From: Ronnie Roads [mailto:rkroads@...]
Sent: Friday, February 18, 2000 12:38 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Selo's


From: Ronnie Roads <rkroads@...>

Perceptually Selo's is about 30% slower for me (level 50, Selo's drum) since
the
patch.

Another 50th level bard with whom I spoke agreed and said he sent feedback.
I sent
feedback and petitioned. The GM who answered submitted a bug report. I
also
contacted Shada and a few others to ask them if they noticed and to submit
something
if they had.

I unfortunately have no hard baseline against which to compare. Would
someone who
does please repeat a test?

On a happier note and to address someone who asked about the minotaur hero:
I
completed the quest last night. When I arrived in Steamfont a druid
gentleman was
waiting for the hero and said he had been there 4 hours and missed the one
spawn
when he left briefly. He soon logged and I was very fortunate because the
hero
spwaned when I had been there less than an hour. So that is two heroes in
about 5
hours. I know people were camping Meldrath and I was killing minos in the
maze for
something to do and with slight hope it would help. Perhaps I was just very
very
lucky; perhaps killing the minos did help. Either way I am very pleased =).

Oh one other thing: GrimFeather drops lambent stones, did you know?

//Maravana Vireo
//50th Bard of Jus Divinum
//Mithaniel Marr
